I have Mozilla firefox 1.5.0.6. And I have problem with textarea - if you enter string without spaces - firefox not shows the content (Inside of the source of this page content exists, but not appear in browser).
I checked this problem with IE 6th version - works correctly.
I'm not tested with Linux version of your browser...

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create HTML file, with the form, and textarea field.
2. In this textarea enter srting without spaces on 4096 symbols (my lenght is 6204 symbols - and it's not working)
3. Try to open this file in browser. You will not see any symbol in textarea.




These symbols already exists in textarea, but not appear - like a white colored symbols on white background.
First time it makes me confused, but when I opened source code - I understood that you've got a problem...
So, please solve it...

I can confirm that this is the case too.
Paste a very long unbroken string into a textarea, you will not see content but it is there.
A string like '01AF66666666666642346243' with a few hundred characters will demonstrate this bug.
